text: Schengen visa rules allow stays of up to 90 days in any 180-day period across the 29 Schengen Area member states. Applicants must submit an application form, valid passport, ICAO- compliant photos, medical travel insurance, and proof of purpose, financial means, accommodation, and intention to return. Entry into the Schengen Area starts a 180-day counter, and overstaying is not allowed. The visa sticker specifies permitted days. Key Rules Visa validity: Maximum 90 days within any 180-day period; applies to the entire Schengen Area, not per country. Passport validity: Must be valid for at least 3 months beyond intended departure. Entry types: Single-entry: one entry only. Multiple-entry: repeated entries allowed, but stays must follow the 90/180 rule. Competent authority: Apply to the embassy/consulate of your main destination or the first- entry country if no main destination. Required Documents Completed Schengen visa application form Valid passport with minimum three months validity beyond departure date ICAO-standard passport photos Proof of Schengen medical travel insurance (covers medical emergencies, hospitalization, repatriation; minimum €30,000) Supporting documents for purpose of stay: Flight bookings Hotel bookings or accommodation proof Bank statements, payslips Proof of financial means Cover letter explaining purpose Evidence of intention to return Fingerprints are collected unless exempt Recent Changes for Indian Nationals Eligibility for 2-year multiple-entry visa requires at least two previously used Schengen visas in the last three years. After using a 2-year MEV, eligibility may extend to a 5-year multiple-entry visa. Visa validity cannot exceed passport expiry. Schengen Travel Rules (Dos) 1. Ensure proper validity Visa stays max 90 days in 180 days; cannot be exceeded. Invalid visa can lead to penalties or bans. 2. Carry essential documents Passport, insurance, accommodation proof, return ticket, and other required docs must be carried. 3. Respect local customs Understand local traditions; behave accordingly. Schengen Travel Rules (Don’ts) 1. Don’t ignore travel insurance Mandatory; minimum €30,000 coverage for emergencies. 2. Avoid overstaying Overstaying can result in deportation or legal consequences. 3. Don’t carry prohibited items Must follow each country’s customs regulations. New Visa Rules Summary Indians can receive 2-year Schengen visas. This can extend to 5-year multiple-entry visas. Allows multiple entries without needing new visas as long as passport validity supports it. FAQ Extract What is a Schengen visa? Allows travel across 29 Schengen countries with one visa. Meaning of first point of entry? The first Schengen country you will enter; responsible for issuing visa if it’s your main entry. How to apply? Apply at the relevant consulate or online; travel brokers can assist.
